meanings.sent1: The ivoriest statue in the museum was so smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was the ivoriest shade of white, standing out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The chef's specialty was an ivoriest cake that looked almost too perfect to eat.
meanings.sent4: The ivoriest clouds floated lazily across the sky, like fluffy cotton balls.
meanings.sent5: The ivoriest keys on the piano gleamed under the stage lights.

meanings.sent1: The elephant's tusks were the ivoriest of all, shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The artist used the ivoriest paint to create a masterpiece on canvas.
meanings.sent3: The ivoriest snowfall of the year blanketed the town in a sparkling white coat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the ivoriest, lighting up the room with its brightness.
meanings.sent5: The ivoriest teeth in the animal kingdom belonged to the majestic walrus.

meanings.definition: Having the color or qualities of ivory.
meanings.sent1: The antique chair had the ivoriest hue, adding elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: The old piano had the ivoriest keys, worn smooth from years of playing.
meanings.sent3: The ivoriest sunset painted the sky in shades of pink and gold.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was the ivoriest, soft and soothing like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The ivoriest silk scarf fluttered in the wind, a delicate touch of luxury.
